channel.title: History on Greg Herlein
channel.description: Recent content in History on Greg Herlein

item.title: What Would Grace Say?
item.description:
Grace Hopper built the first compiler in 1952. The establishment told her she was nuts. Computers do arithmetic, they said. You can’t make them understand English-like instructions. She had a running compiler and nobody would touch it.

Today, people say “real programmers write code, not prompts.” Sound familiar? Grace had some thoughts about this kind of thinking. She had a lot of thoughts, actually.

item.title: Lost Boats Ceremony - Tolling of the Boats 2024
item.description: Memorial Day is special to me as a former submariner. Many have sacrificed for our freedoms, but the US Submarine Force more than many. Memorial Day is when I honor that.
